III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section Intervention standards and prohibitions
Description (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation There were concerns that a youth does not feel safe at the facility.
The staff have been physically abusive towards this youth.
Investigation Interviews:
Ambulance Driver was interviewed via phone on August
20,2025. Ambulance Driver reported he was transporting Youth A
back to the facility on August 19, 2025. He reported Youth A
reported to him the staff were physically and verbally abusive
towards her. Ambulance Driver reported Youth A did not give any
specific details about this and noted she has talked to people
about this already. He reported the main concerning issue was
she showed him a popcorn kernel-sized mark near her left elbow
and stated the staff gave her that mark from a restraint.
Ambulance Driver reported Youth A did not give him any details
about the event. He reported if she had never mentioned the
mark, he would not have seen it. Ambulance Driver reported
Youth A never made any complaints about having to go back to
the facility or ask to go somewhere else, so he stated the situation
was a bit odd. He reported when she arrived to the facility, she
had no issues with going back to the unit or being released to
staff.
Youth A was briefly interviewed by this consultant face to
face at the facility on August 20,2025. It should be noted that
this was agreed upon with MDHHS Worker that this
consultant could complete an on-site visit unannounced to
do a check-in with Youth A and Manager. Upon arrival at the
unit, Youth A asked this consultant if they were there to talk with
her. This consultant explained it is part of their job to do check-ins
every so often with the youth who live at the facility. Youth A
reported she did not have any concerns about this facility and
reported staff have been treating her well. She denied having any
concerns that she wanted to report. Youth A reported Supervisor
2

was a good support person to her and would go to her if she had
any concerns about the treatment she was getting at the facility.
Youth A was interviewed a second time face to face at the
facility on August 22, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS
Worker. Youth A reported things are going okay at the facility.
She reported the staff treated her well. Youth A denied any
concerns of physical abuse from staff.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on August
22, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported
she has been working at the facility for the past two months and
has worked as Youth A’s one-to-one support staff. She reported
Youth A has never reported to her that the staff have been
physically abusive towards her. Staff 1 reported she has never
witnessed staff being physically abusive towards any of the youth,
including Youth A.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
August 22, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Supervisor reported Youth A has never disclosed any concerns
about staff being physically abusive towards her. She reported
she has never witnessed staff being physically abusive towards
Youth A. Supervisor reported staff are to use verbal de-escalation
with Youth A when she is escalated. She reported she has a
positive relationship with Youth A, and if she had a complaint
about staff, she would be quick to report that concern to
Supervisor.
Manager was interviewed face to face at the facility on
August 20, 2025. Manager reported on August 18, 2025, Youth A
went to the children’s hospital due to concerns of suicidal ideation.
She reported Youth A stayed at the hospital until August 19, 2025,
because the hospital determined Youth A did not meet the need of
inpatient criteria. Manager reported an ambulance was used to
transport Youth A back to the facility on August 19, 2025. She
reported she did a check-in with Youth A this morning, and Youth
A had no complaints or concerns to report to her.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on August
22, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B
reported she has never witnessed any staff being verbally or
physically abusive towards the youth. She reported she feels safe
at the facility, except when Youth A is acting up because she will
become violent. Youth B reported she has witnessed staff respond
3

to Youth A’s behavior appropriately and will move the other youth
off the unit to keep them safe.
Documents Reviewed:
- Facility Behavior Management Procedures- Prohibited
Techniques with the most recent revision date of June
2, 2025- This policy notes that any physical punishment
including spanking, hitting, pinching, slapping, hair pulling,
mouth washing, sitting or standing in a specific position,
strenuous physical exercise or threatening to use any of
these methods is prohibited.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as there were no reported
concerns from Youth A and Youth B of staff physically abusing the
youth.
Conclusion Violation Not Established

Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159
Section Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention;
Description prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints
(5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth's behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth's
treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On an unknown date, staff used too much force when attempting
to restraint the youth. The youth has a popcorn sized wound on
the left elbow as a result of the restraint.
6

Investigation Interviews:
Ambulance Driver was interviewed via phone on August
20,2025. Ambulance Driver reported he was transporting Youth A
back to the facility on August 19, 2025. He reported Youth A
reported to him the staff were physically and verbally abusive
towards her. Ambulance Driver reported Youth A did not give any
specific details about this and noted she has talked to people
about this already. He reported the main concerning issue was
she showed him a popcorn kernel-sized mark near her left elbow
and stated the staff gave her that mark from a restraint.
Ambulance Driver reported Youth A did not give him any details
about the event. He reported if she had never mentioned the
mark, he would not have seen it. Ambulance Driver reported
Youth A never made any complaints about having to go back to
the facility or ask to go somewhere else, so he stated the situation
was a bit odd. He reported when she got to the facility, she had no
issues with going back to the unit or being released to staff.
Youth A was briefly interviewed by this consultant face to
face at the facility on August 20,2025. It should be noted that
this was agreed upon with MDHHS Worker that this
consultant could complete an on-site visit unannounced to
do a check-in with Youth A and Manager. Upon arrival at the
unit, Youth A asked this consultant if they were there to talk with
her. This consultant explained it is part of their job to do check-ins
every so often with the youth who live at the facility. Youth A
reported she did not have any concerns about this facility and
reported staff have been treating her well. She denied having any
concerns she wanted to report. Consultant asked Youth A about
her most recent trip to the hospital, and Youth A reported she just
returned last night. She reported things went well at the hospital.
This consultant asked Youth A about hearing of a concern of a
wound on her elbow. Youth A then showed this consultant her left
elbow. There was a round mark near Youth A’s elbow that was the
size of an eraser on a pencil. It appeared to look like an older
wound with a scab that has been picked at. Youth A explained
when she was in a fight with another peer at the facility, she was
scratched by that peer. She reported she just continues to pick at
the scab. Youth A reported the fight with the peer was the same
fight she spoke to this consultant about. It should be noted this
incident in question was covered in Special Investigation
2025SIC0000895.
Youth A was interviewed a second time face to face at the
facility on August 22,2025, in collaboration with MDHHS
Worker. Youth A reported the mark on her arm is from the fight
7

she got into with Youth C. She reported Youth C scratched her,
and she continued to pick the scab open. It should be noted this
incident in question was covered in Special Investigation
2025SIC0000895. Youth A denied the mark on her arm came
from staff. She reported she has not been restrained in months.
She stated she does not like restraints because the restraints
make her feel uncomfortable due to her trauma history. Youth A
denied ever getting hurt by staff in a restraint.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on August
22, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported
she was Youth A’s one-to-one staff when she was at the hospital
on August 18, 2025, and August 19, 2025. She reported at one
point, a nurse pointed out that Youth A was scratching at a scab
on her left elbow but never reported it came from getting hurt by
staff or Youth C. Staff 1 reported Youth A had great behavior at
the hospital because she was getting the one-to-one attention.
She reported she has never restrained Youth A and has never
witnessed a staff member restrain Youth A. Staff 1 reported staff
are using more verbal de-escalation with Youth A.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
August 22, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Supervisor reported Youth A has never made a complaint about a
mark on her elbow and was unaware of a mark. She reported
Youth A has not been restrained by staff in months, and Youth A
has never reported any concerns about a restraint by staff.
Supervisor reported she was present when Youth A and Youth C
got into a physical fight. She reported Youth A never made a
complaint about getting scratched on her arm and noted the only
concern was her eye was hurting from getting punched, therefore
nursing was consulted.
Manager was interviewed face to face at the facility on
August 20, 2025. Manager reported on August 18, 2025, Youth A
went to the children’s hospital due to concerns of suicidal ideation.
She reported Youth A stayed at the hospital until August 19, 2025,
because the hospital determined Youth A did not meet the need of
inpatient criteria. Manager reported an ambulance was the one to
transport Youth A back to the facility on August 19, 2025. She
reported she did a check-in with Youth A this morning, and Youth
A had no complaints or concerns to report to her. Manager
reported she was unaware of any marks being on Youth A’s elbow
or how that happened. She reported Youth A has not been
restrained by staff in a couple of months.
8

Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on August
22, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B
reported she had witnessed getting restrained before by staff
when she was showing unsafe behavior. She reported staff did
not cause her any harm when it happened and the restraint was
months ago. Youth B is unaware of Youth A getting any marks on
her body from the staff. She reported staff try to use verbal de-
escalation with Youth A when she is behaviorally escalated.
Documents Reviewed:
- Facility Nursing Note for Youth A dated July 17, 2025-
Youth A was seen in person by nursing due to being
punched in the eye by Youth C. During the physical exam,
nursing noted there was no significant swelling of orbital
socket but noted some minor bruising below Youth A’s left
eye. Nursing did a follow up check later that day which
there were no further noted concerns of vision loss or
redness. There were no reported concerns about Youth A
getting scratched by Youth C or any other injuries.
- Facility MiSACWIS incident report 218130265 dated
August 18, 2025- Youth A was in her bathroom and staff
heard a noise sounding like broken glass. Staff were able
to get the door open and found Youth A holding a big piece
of glass trying to harm herself. Staff were able to get the
glass away from Youth A using verbal de-escalation. Youth
A went to the hospital for a mental health evaluation due to
the unsafe behavior.
- Facility Behavior Management report dated June 4,
2025- This report was the last noted restraint report for
Youth A. The report noted staff had to go hands on with
Youth A due to her taking out wires out of the tv and was
touching the exposed wires to the wires on the fire alarm.
Youth A was also attempting to cause harm to herself.
Youth A did not respond to verbal de-escalation. She was
placed in a restraint for about three minutes. The report
notes there were no injuries to staff or youth during the
restraint.
- Facility’s Crisis Management Procedure dated July 25,
2023- Staff should only use physical restraint in emergency
situations to ensure a youth’s physical safety or safety of
others, and only when all less restrictive interventions are
9

determined to be ineffective. Physical restraint should only
be performed in a manner that is safe, appropriate and
proportionate to severity of the minor child’s behavior,
chronological and developmental age, size, gender,
physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric condition,
and personal history, including any history of physical or
sexual abuse.
- Special Investigation 2025SIC0000895- Youth A had
gotten into a physical fight with Youth C. Within this
investigation, Youth A had reported an injury of getting hit
in the eye by Youth C. Youth A did see nursing for this
injury and did not ever report any injury to her elbow. There
was no licensing violations found within this investigation,
and it was determined staff handled the situation
appropriately.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as Youth A reported the mark
on her arm came from another youth and from a staff restraining
her. This incident was investigated in Special Investigation
2025SIC0000895 which there were no rule violations found. There
were no concerns within the last restraint report that Youth A was
involved in any injury. Both Youth A and Youth B denied ever
being in a restraint with staff where they had been injured.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
